title: How to Wear a Fanny Pack

steps.title: This is an easy way to keep your essentials within reach.
steps.content: This is an easy way to keep your essentials within reach. Try wearing your fanny pack around your natural waist just above your belly button. [1] X Expert Source Jordan Stolch Image Consultant & Style Advisor Expert Interview. 25 September 2020. Wearing a fanny pack here will also help you highlight your figure and give your waist more definition. If you have a small fanny pack, try looping it through your belt loops for a more subtle approach. If you don’t want your fanny pack to be front and center, try turning the pack around to your back.

steps.title: Your fanny pack will look more like a purse or a small handbag.
steps.content: Your fanny pack will look more like a purse or a small handbag. Buckle your fanny pack together and throw it over one shoulder, then position the pack itself in front of your chest. [2] X Research source This looks really cool if done over a blazer or a fitted denim jacket. [3] X Expert Source Jordan Stolch Image Consultant & Style Advisor Expert Interview. 25 September 2020. If you don’t want your fanny pack front and center, slide the pack itself around to your back. When you need to reach your stuff, just position the pack in front of your chest again.

steps.title: A fanny pack on top of your outerwear is easy to style.
steps.content: A fanny pack on top of your outerwear is easy to style. Sling your fanny pack over your jacket, use your fanny pack as a belt, or tuck in your shirt to draw attention to your fanny pack. This will also make it easier to grab anything you need out of the pack throughout the day. Or, try a two-piece suit with matching pants and a jacket. Underneath, wear a simple white T-shirt or a bodysuit; then, put your fanny pack high on your waist to close the jacket. [4] X Expert Source Jordan Stolch Image Consultant & Style Advisor Expert Interview. 25 September 2020.

steps.title: Your outfit doesn’t have to revolve around your fanny pack.
steps.content: Your outfit doesn’t have to revolve around your fanny pack. Wrap your fanny pack around your waist and put on a simple fitted tee. Then, throw on a jacket to complete the look. [5] X Research source This look is great for a rock concert or date night, depending on what jacket you choose! You can also try this look with a statement top and no jacket, such as a plunging silk top with billowy arms that falls just over the top of the fanny pack.

steps.title: Black fanny packs go with anything, while bold colors will stand out a little more.
steps.content: Black fanny packs go with anything, while bold colors will stand out a little more. If you’re putting together an everyday, casual look, pick out a solid-colored fanny pack. [6] X Research source White, blue, green, red, and yellow fanny packs all make a fun statement piece in any outfit. You can create sporty or athletic looks with a plain black fanny pack. Match it with a pair of joggers and a hoodie for a casual day out. Or, add a bit of femininity to a more masculine outfit with a bold color. Pair a pink, red, or yellow fanny pack with an oversized button-down and fitted trousers.

steps.title: If the rest of your look is a little plain, use your fanny pack as an accent piece.
steps.content: If the rest of your look is a little plain, use your fanny pack as an accent piece. Pick one out that has a bold pattern and bright colors to tie your whole outfit together. [7] X Research source Stripes, polka dots, camouflage, and triangles all look super cool with a monochromatic outfit. Be bold by wearing a patterned fanny pack with an oversized pantsuit or skirt and top set. Or, add a camouflage fanny pack to cargo pants and a tank top for a masculine look.

steps.title: You can wear a fanny pack to a semi-formal event.
steps.content: You can wear a fanny pack to a semi-formal event. Opt for a small clutch-sized fanny pack to pair with dresses or suits for a night out. A "little black bag" is a good option, as it can go with many outfits. Try one with a slender leather strap or even a delicate chain. Small envelope-style fanny packs look great on top of a structured pantsuit.

steps.title: Traditional fanny packs are great for everyday wear.
steps.content: Traditional fanny packs are great for everyday wear. Grab a large, slouchy fanny pack to throw on when you go to school, out with friends, or on a hike. [8] X Research source A black bag pairs with almost anything, while bright or patterned ones can make a statement in any look. These slouchy fanny packs are usually bigger, too, so you can fit more things inside of them.

steps.title: This is a classic look you can wear almost anywhere.
steps.content: This is a classic look you can wear almost anywhere. Pair a fanny pack with your favorite t-shirt and jeans, then sling it over your hips for a walk in the park or a fun day at a festival. If you’re going for a more streetwear look, try an oversized shirt instead of a fitted one. To tie in the edgy coolness of the fanny pack, wear a cool graphic T-shirt that's more trendy. Finish off the look with a good solid white sneaker. [9] X Expert Source Jordan Stolch Image Consultant & Style Advisor Expert Interview. 25 September 2020. Or, spice up your look with mules or a pair of strappy sandals.

steps.title: You can wear this look for a night out on the town.
steps.content: You can wear this look for a night out on the town. Put on your favorite mini dress, then add your fanny pack on top to define your waist and emphasize your figure. [10] X Research source Try to pick a fanny pack with good quality material, like leather, silk, or wool. This look works best for casual looks, date night, and semi-formal events, depending on the bag you choose. Skip it for formal events.

steps.title: Enamel or acrylic pins can make your fanny pack stand out.
steps.content: Enamel or acrylic pins can make your fanny pack stand out. Pick out pins or buttons with fun sayings or cute characters, then arrange them on your bag for a fun look that’s all yours! [11] X Research source You could even add floral brooches for a vintage touch. Thrift stores usually have a wide variety of pins to choose from, or you can look online. If you’re looking for a more feminine touch, try adding a hair bow.

steps.title: You can pick out patches that perfectly match your style.
steps.content: You can pick out patches that perfectly match your style. Try adding stars, flowers, fun sayings, kittens, or even your own name. [12] X Research source You can find patches online or at most craft stores. Patches usually work best on cotton or synthetic materials, but they probably won’t stick to leather fanny packs.
